quotes.quote: [During Fancourt period in office] the Author of the following historical sketch had determined on writing, principally for the satisfaction of the Settlers, an account of the origin, the rise, and the development of one of the most remarkable possessions of the British Crown. It did not however occur to him then, that it would be necessary for the completion of his design to trace the connection of European enterprise with Central America to an earlier period than 1662, when the British logwood-cutters first commenced their operations on the coast of Yucatan.
quotes.quote_n: With as little delay as possible, the Author will lay before the Public an additional volume [forthcoming], which will comprise the History of Yucatan, from the period when the British logwood-cutters commenced their operations at Cape Catoche, to the close of the administration in British Honduras of his immediate predecessor Major-General Alexander Macdonald. /v Fancourt p vi
